post_text:
Students are wasting no time getting hands-on experiences at Clinton Technical School (CTS).

The Clinton Technical School serves students in the Clinton School District, as well as ten area school districts. This year we are excited to welcome our two newest Districts, Weaubleau and Wheatland, to the CTS family.

Clinton Technical School provides nine Career and Technical Education programs to high school students (Agriculture, Automotive Technology, Building Trades, Business Education, Computer Networking and Repair, Health Occupations, Machine Tool Technology, Marketing and Welding).

These programs prepare students for college and careers, as well as provides students the opportunity to learn skills that will allow them to make a positive impact in their community.

#CardinalPride

You have 10 more days to sign-up!

The annual Clinton Education Foundation 5K Fun Run will be held on Saturday, September 26th. You can sign-up at www.clintonmo5k.com.

Funds raised through this event will be returned to CSD teachers in the form of Classroom Impact Grants. These grants are used to fund programs or needs that fall beyond budget limitations.

**The Education Foundation has developed a COVID-19 safety plan that has been reviewed and approved by Golden Valley Memorial Healthcare. The Foundation will be following all CDC guidelines for this event and will be working to keep runners, walkers and volunteers as safe as possible.**

Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School Greater Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce 95.3 KDKD FM The Clinton Daily Democrat

post_text:
Good morning, Cardinals....it's Wednesday!

Daisy (pictured below) is Henry Elementary's therapy dog and she took a few minutes of her time this week to share with us the right (and wrong) ways to wear a face covering.

When wearing a face covering, Daisy wants us to make sure that both our mouth and nose (or in Daisy's case, snout) are covered up.

Remember, wearing a face covering, washing your hands, keeping a safe distance from others and staying home when you are sick, are simple ways that we can keep ourselves and others healthy, as well as keep our schools open.

We're in this together, Cardinals!

#CardinalPride #SafeCardinals

Clinton Early Childhood Center Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School

post_text:
Did you know that Canada is the world's leading producer of "lowbush blueberries", more commonly known as wild blueberries?

During their study of the United States and Canada, Clinton High School students in Mrs. Woods' World Foods class made blueberry muffins from scratch.

This class emphasizes the variety in food products and preparation techniques, experimentation in meal patterns and the significance of food as it relates to various cultures and conditions. The course also places an emphasis on the history, geography, culture and foods from other countries.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
It's National Information Technology (IT) Professionals Day!

Never before has it been so important to recognize the hard work of these dedicated staff members. The countless hours the CSD's IT team has put in during the pandemic has helped to keep the district "humming", teachers teaching and students learning.

In the last month our IT team has deployed over 600 Chromebooks to CHS and virtual learning students. This huge task has been completed while also providing staff training, troubleshooting technology issues, and so much more.

We are so thankful to have these amazing individuals as a part of our Cardinal family!

Left to right: Skip Cooley (Director of Technology), Megan Gretzinger (Director of Instructional Technology), Michael Bowman (IT Technician) and Dickie McClendon (IT Technician)

#CardinalPride #ITProDay

post_text:
The story below was shared by Henry Elementary and CIS art teacher, Bridgette McCoy. What a great reminder of the goodness and kindness that exist in our community during these trying times.

"Yesterday at Walmart I noticed kids’ scissors were on sale and thought we could spare $30 of our own funds to get new, cleaner scissors for my classes. It’s what teachers do. My classrooms have scissors, but it’s just nice to have some newer ones, right?

As I load up all 60 pairs of scissors, a gentleman behind me in line says, “Looks like someone is getting school supplies...” I told him my plan.

Then I hear, “Take this. Teachers are always spending money on their classes and I want to do this...for the kids.”

This stranger paid for my classrooms’ scissors! It took all of me to not cry.

Believe there is good ❤️

Thank you, kind stranger!"

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Clinton High School students in Mrs. McKeehan's ELA classes have been talking about the "American Dream" and how it relates to American Literature.

Students recently participated in an activity that simulates the ability to attain the "American Dream". The students were put in rows and a recycling bin, the "American Dream", was placed in the very front row. Each student then had a chance to try and toss a piece of paper into the bin.

Students quickly began to realize that students closest to the bin were at an advantage because they were in the very front, versus the students in the back who had several obstacles to face to achieve their dream.

Students then applied this situation to the "real world" and the advantages and disadvantages some may have reaching their "American Dream".

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Becoming a Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) is a great way to start your nursing career!

Clinton Technical School (CTS) is taking applications and providing entrance testing to those interested in starting the Practical Nursing Program in 2021.

In one year you will gain quick entry into the nursing field from an accredited practical nursing program through hands-on experiences and excellent instruction and guidance from a professional and caring staff. Over 200 students have graduated from the program and become nurses in a variety of healthcare fields.

The entrance test (TEAS - Test of Essential Academic Skills) is given on-site at CTS during the month of September and the application deadline is October 9th.

For more information, visit our website at https://cts.clintoncardinals.org/post-_secondary_programs/practical_nursing_program

You can also contact Bev Dickey at 660-885-6101.

#CardinalPride

The Clinton Daily Democrat 95.3 KDKD FM

Last week, Clinton FFA students participated in the virtual 2020 Missouri State Career Development Events (the organization's state level judging contests). The Clinton FFA Chapter was well represented, with multiple top 20 finishes in several different events.

Dairy Cattle- 220 students competed in the state:
Alyssa Robertson-2nd Place
Trista Humphrey- 3rd Place

Ag Sales- 208 students competed in the state:
Victor Chapa-6th Place
Cauy Collins-10th Place
Lauren Bailey-17th Place

Forestry-99 students competed in the state:

Look at these safe and stylish Cardinals!

Eighth graders in Mrs. Harrison's Cardinal Time class and 3rd graders in Mrs. Engeman's class had fun with some tie-dye and masks earlier this week.

post_text:
Yesterday, for the first day of school, Clinton High School Project Lead the Way (PLTW) engineering students were tasked with drawing a smiley face on the ground. Students were challenged to do this with their group members while maintaining 6 ft distance only using tape and a marker!

In this PLTW class, students are introduced to the engineering profession and a common approach to the solution of engineering problems, an engineering design process. Utilizing the activity-project-problem-based teaching and learning pedagogy, students progress from completing structured activities to solving open ended projects and problems that require them to develop planning, documentation, communication, and other professional skills.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Tomorrow is a big day!

For five long months we have waited and prepared to open our doors to our Cardinals.

We have planned (and planned some more), so that our students could come back to school in the safest way possible.

Even with the many hours of preparation, we know that not everything will be perfect tomorrow. Buses will be late, car rider lines will move slowly and those school office phones will be busy.

But despite all that might go wrong, our promise to you is this-our staff will take care of your children, build relationships with them, help them grow academically this year and do all we can to keep them safe. YOUR kids are also OUR kids.

If we show each other patience, flexibility, grace and kindness, we can make it through the first day, and every day after that.

TOGETHER, WE GOT THIS!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
We are so excited to see our students on Monday, but we have three important reminders for our Cardinals!

**Don't forget to use the self-screening checklist below**
**Grab a face covering**
**Grab a water bottle**

Every morning before coming to school, staff and students must self-screen using the Daily Self-Screening Checklist below. You can find a printable version to hang on your refrigerator here:
https://clintoncardinals.org/UserFiles/Servers/Server_4285567/Image/District/Return%20to%20Learn/daily%20symptom%20checklist%20(1).pdf

You can also find the self-screening document front and center on our app. To get the app on your phone, search for "Clinton School District" on Google Play or the Apple App Store.

**We can not emphasize enough the importance of staying home if you are not feeling well.**

Together we can protect the health and safety of our students, staff and community!

#CardinalPride

Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School Clinton Early Childhood Center

post_text:
COME SUBSTITUTE TEACH WITH US!

The Clinton School District is now hiring substitute teachers.
There are currently two paths to receiving a substitute teaching certificate.

1). Complete 60 hours of college credit.
2). Complete 20 hours of online training. This pathway was recently approved by the the State Board of Education as an alternative to the previous requirement of 60 hours of college credit. This emergency rule will take effect on September 2.

Additional information regarding the online training, including approved vendors and associated costs, can be found at the link below.
https://dese.mo.gov/educator-quality/certification/substitute-teachers

You can apply to be a substitute teacher in the Clinton School District at this link.
https://clintoncardinals.org/employment/substitute_teaching

Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School Clinton Early Childhood Center

post_text:
Can you help us paint the town RED and BLUE and provide encouragement and support for students and staff on their first day of school?

#CardinalPride
shared_text:
Bright Futures Clinton is feeling excited.
August 24 at 5:39 PM ·

HELP SPREAD THE WORD!!!
Monday is the first day of school for Clinton School District students and staff. Unfortunately, schools are unable to welcome volunteers right now, so we're unable to enjoy our usual 1st day "welcome back" activities. Let's get the students' minds off the uncertainty and anxiety of going back to school in this uncertain time. Let's all come together to show our students and staff that we are with them, we support them, and we care about them!
On Monday, we ask that the Clinton community PAINT THE TOWN RED AND BLUE!
Wear your Cardinal gear! Line the streets and bus routes in the mornings with signs (Welcome Back to School Cardinals!, Thank you Teachers!, Have a Great Day at School!) and wave and cheer for our Cardinals as they prepare for their day! Involve your civic group or business! Businesses can help by putting messages of support on your signs or windows and posters/balloons on your doors! Families can involve younger children by dressing up, making posters, and waving to buses.
Please share and help spread the word! Thank you for your support!

AFTER-SCHOOL CARE PROGRAMS

Enrollment is now open for CECC, Henry Elementary and Clinton Intermediate School's After-School Care Programs (Latchkey).

The Latchkey Program runs from the end of the school day until 6:00 pm at each of the three schools listed above. If school is not in session, Latchkey will also not be in session. The after school care program will follow the safety protocols required by the district.

Enrollment forms and parent handbook can be found here on our District website: https://clintoncardinals.org/for_parents/after_school_care.

If you should have any questions, please email Lori Shannon at lshannon@clintoncardinals.org

post_text:
Progress as Promised!

This week, work began to add safety features to the bleacher seating at Cardinal Stadium.

Improvements to the seating at Cardinal Stadium has been mentioned as a safety priority by community members, and with the passage of the bond issue in June, we are able to make this a reality!

Now when you visit Cardinal Stadium, you will notice handrails, gaps closed between bleachers, added fencing and more.

In the months ahead, we will be sharing other projects made possible by the bond issue.

Thank you to our community for their continued support of our students and District. You are appreciated!

#CardinalPride

BACK TO SCHOOL TIP

You can access breakfast and lunch menus on the district website under the "For Parents" tab or using the "menu" quick link under the scrolling pictures on the home page (August/September menus will be added soon). These menus can also easily be accessed through the district's mobile app.

Below are the breakfast and lunch prices for each building. There are two options for paying for school meals. Parents can send money to the school or can use our online payment system, RevTrak, to make payments. RevTrak can be accessed under the "For Parents" tab or using the "online payment" quick link.

Free/reduced meal applications are available at all school offices and on the website under the "For Parents" tab. A new form must be completed each year.

Breakfast Prices:
CECC/Henry/CIS-$1.50
CMS/CHS-$1.55
Reduced breakfast at all buildings-$.30

Lunch Prices:
CECC/Henry/CIS-$2.10
CMS-$2.15
CHS-$2.20
Reduced lunch at all buildings-$.40

Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School

post_text:
BACK TO SCHOOL TIP

It is always our goal to have the most up-to-date contact information for our families. One of the ways we will reach out to parents regarding important events, school closings, and safety alerts is via our text messaging service through SchoolMessenger.

If you received text messages from our district last year AND your cell phone number has not changed, there is nothing further you need to do.
If you did not receive text messages from the district last year OR your cell number has changed, there are TWO very important steps you need to take.

1). Provide your child's school with the cell number where you wish to receive text messages (please also provide the school office with your email address).

2). After updating your preferred number with the school office, follow the simple steps on the document below. You MUST opt-in to receive text messages from the district.

Clinton Early Childhood Center Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Important information from CHS!

#CardinalPride
shared_text:
Clinton High School
August 13 at 3:46 PM ·

In an effort to cut down on person to person contact we will not be doing in person registrations this year. All students will receive in the mail soon forms that need filled out and directions to return them electronically. We are also in the process of fine tuning our online payment system so all fees can be paid electronically.

We will release information about Freshman Orientation early next week, the format will be modified with videos for key information and then times available for incoming Freshman to come into the school and tour. Dates for Freshman to tour the building will be August 27th and 28th, stay tuned for details and sign ups for tour times.

Please follow our Social Media outlets (Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram) for updates as well as a mailed letter that will be sent soon. Student schedules are slated to be "live" in Powerschool by August 24th.

Thank you for your patience and flexibility as we start the school year, feel free to call our office with any questions or leave a comment below.

Go Cardinals! Clinton Schools

post_text:
Welcome to the family!

Clinton High School will be welcoming Brian Chervitz to their building this year as a history teacher.

Mr. Chervitz graduated with a B.S.Ed. in Secondary Social Studies Education and a B.A. in Political Science from the University of Missouri. He also has a Master's degree in Curriculum and Instruction from the University of Wisconsin. This will be Mr. Chervitz' first year teaching.

Brian is originally from Manchester, MO. His fiance works as an analyst for a hospital system and together they have one cat. In his spare time, Brian enjoys reading and tackling DIY projects in his new home.

"I love the values embodied by the staff and administration, especially keeping students the first priority! And I'm so excited to teach the students, our next generation of citizens and leaders in Missouri and beyond, about history and government!"

#CardinalPride

Welcome to the family!

Clinton High School is excited to welcome Loribeth Quick as a special education teacher this school year.

Mrs. Quick graduated from UCM, and has previous work experience in social work and mental healthcare fields and has worked in the Warrensburg School District for the past 18 years.

Loribeth is originally from Windsor, MO, but has lived in Warrensburg for the past 14 years with her husband and three children. In their spare time, the family enjoys spending time together outdoors.

"I am excited to be a part of the Clinton Cardinal family! I look forward to providing educational support to students while helping them attain their educational goals!"

post_text:
BACK TO SCHOOL TIP

Throughout the next few weeks, we will be providing families "Back to School Tips" to help you prepare for the first day of school (August 31st for In-Person Learning and August 24th for Virtual Learning).

Our first piece of helpful information comes from our nurse's office.

Are your child's immunizations up-to-date? Students entering kindergarten, 8th grade and 12th grade have certain immunization requirements.

If your child is in need of immunizations, please contact your child's physician or the Henry County Health Center to schedule immunizations before school starts. Henry County Health Center will be holding an immunization clinic on August 20th from 3:00-7:00 at Clinton High School. You can learn more and register online here: http://ow.ly/K8z750AFsUJ

**Please note-Students who have enrolled in Virtual Learning, are still students of the Clinton School District and must have up-to-date immunizations as well.**

Clinton Early Childhood Center Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School

#CardinalPride

post_text:
The Clinton School District is currently accepting applications for substitute teachers, substitute nurses and substitute crossing guards for the 2020-2021 school year.

Applicants for substitute teachers must have a current substitute teaching certificate or be able to obtain one. Applicants for substitute nurses must have a current nursing license. All applicants will be required to pass a fingerprint background screening.

These positions are on an as needed basis. Substitute application packets are available at the Administration Office located at 701 S. 8th Street, Clinton, Missouri. Or you can find more information on our website at the link below:
https://www.clintoncardinals.org/employ…/substitute_teaching

Clinton Early Childhood Center Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Middle School Clinton High School The Clinton Daily Democrat 95.3 KDKD FM Greater Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce

Clinton Middle School
August 4 at 2:30 PM ·

CMS will offer in person enrollment/registration next week.

Students and parents are welcome to stop by between the hours listed below. During this visit, students can pick-up schedules, pay student fees, visit the nurse, and tour the building. Parents will have an opportunity to gain access to PowerSchool, join the PTO, pick up important information regarding activities, arrival and departure procedures, bell schedule, updated school supply lists, and additional information. It is important that we have current demographic information for all students. You will receive a letter later this week with detailed information include a demographic information page with the information we have on file for your student. Please return this form at registration with any corrections. We look forward to meeting you during the following times:

5:00pm – 8:00pm

10:00am – 12:00pm
5:00pm – 8:00pm

post_text:
Do you have a child who will be new to the district this year and they haven't enrolled yet?

To enroll a new student, you will need immunization records, birth certificate and proof of residency.

Please see information below for building-specific information.

Henry Elementary School-Stop by between 7:30-3:30, Monday-Friday. An enrollment table is set-up under the awning. Staff are available to answer questions and make copies of enrollment documents.

Clinton Intermediate School-Stop by between 7:00-3:00, Monday-Friday. Call 885-3179 when you arrive and a staff member will bring an enrollment packet out to you and make copies of enrollment documents.

Clinton Middle School-Stop by between 7:00-3:00, Monday-Friday. Enrollment packets are available in the foyer of the building.

Clinton High School-Stop by between 7:00-3:00, Monday-Friday. Enrollment packets and instructions are available in the foyer of the building.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Welcome (back) to the family!

Clinton High School is excited to welcome Stephanie Harp back to the District.

Stephanie, a 2006 graduate of CHS, will be the Yearbook/Photography/Personal Finance teacher at Clinton High School. Stephanie previously worked in the CSD as an Administrative Assistant and Secretary to the Board of Education for five years, and most recently was a teacher in the Montrose School District.

Mrs. Harp graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Business from the Park University Education Program at Central Methodist University. She is currently working on her MBA through Park University.

Stephanie and her husband, Cory, have been married for almost 10 years and have three children, Andrew, Max and Emma, two of whom attend Clinton Schools. The family also has a Chesapeake Bay Retriever named Enzo. In her spare time Stephanie loves to spend time with her family and read.

"I am excited to be back at the Clinton School District and give back to the place that helped shape me into who I am today."

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Welcome to the family!

The Clinton School District has hired Megan Gretzinger as the Instructional Technology Director for the 20-21 school year. This is a new position that will provide training and guidance for teachers to improve the use of instructional technology, both in the classroom and in distance learning.

Mrs. Gretzinger graduated from MSU in 2007 with a Bachelors of Science in Education and graduated with her Masters in Administration from William Woods University in 2009. This will be Megan's 14th year in education. She has taught in the Appleton City School District for the past 10 years, where she taught social studies, k-5 keyboarding as well as serving as an Instructional Technology Coach.

Megan was born in Clinton, but grew up in south Texas. Megan, her husband and three young children live on a farm outside of Urich.

"I am thrilled for the opportunity to bring my passion for educational technology to the Clinton School District. I look forward to sharing my knowledge with the great teachers here."

#CardinalPride

Welcome to the family!

Clinton Intermediate School is looking forward to welcoming Danielle Mann as a third grade teacher this school year.

This will be Ms. Mann's first year teaching, but she is familiar with the District as she completed her student-teaching last spring at Henry Elementary. Danielle graduated from the University of Central Missouri with a degree in Early Childhood Education with a minor in Early Childhood Special Education, and is currently working on her Master's degree in Curriculum and Instruction.

Danielle grew up in Festus, MO, and enjoys playing tennis, going shopping, and doing DIY projects at home.

"I can't wait to encourage my students to explore and utilize their creativity to try new things, learn new content, and problem solve."

Welcome to the family!

Erica Hilmas will be joining the Cardinal family as an 8th grade ELA teacher at Clinton Middle School this year. Ms. Hilmas will also be the head boys and girls tennis coach at Clinton High School.

Erica previously taught 8th grade ELA and Theater at Moberly Middle School.

Ms. Hilmas grew up in Rolla, MO and graduated from Mizzou with a degree in Middle School English Education. Erica was a member of her high school’s varsity tennis team and played intramural tennis while a student at Mizzou. During her summers, Erica was on the coaching staff of a girls’ summer camp in Winchester, TN.

In her spare time, Erica enjoys spending time on the lake, reading outside, training for her first half marathon, and taking walks with her fiancé. Erica and her fiancé are moving to Clinton with their spoiled rescue cat, Nala, and their 6-month husky-mix, Thielen.

Help us welcome Erica to the Clinton community!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
If you've been searching for a highly successful Practical Nursing program, the Clinton Technical School has just what you are looking for!

The Clinton Technical School's Practical Nursing program is currently enrolling students for its 2021 class that will begin in January.

The program has full approval by the Missouri State Board of Nursing and is accredited by the Council on Occupational Education. Financial aid is available for those who qualify, and staff is ready to assist you with the financial aid process.

Want to learn more? Call 885-6101 or visit the link below.

https://cts.clintoncardinals.org/post-_secondary_programs/practical_nursing_program

#CardinalPride

post_text:
The Clinton School District is currently accepting applications for substitute teachers, substitute nurses and substitute crossing guards for the 2020-2021 school year.

Applicants for substitute teachers must have a current substitute teaching certificate or be able to obtain one. Applicants for substitute nurses must have a current nursing license. All applicants will be required to pass a fingerprint background screening.

These positions are on an as needed basis. Substitute application packets are available at the Administration Office located at 701 S. 8th Street, Clinton, Missouri. Or you can find more information on our website at the link below:
https://www.clintoncardinals.org/employment/substitute_teaching

The Clinton Daily Democrat KDKD News Greater Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Welcome to the family!

The Clinton School District is excited to welcome Austin Bressman as the assistant band director at CMS and CHS.

This will be Mr. Bressman's first year teaching. He received his degree in Instrumental Music Education from the University of Central Missouri, and student-taught last fall at Oak Park High School and Antioch Middle School in the North Kansas City School District.

Austin grew up in North Kansas City. A fun fact about Austin is that he had the opportunity to play drums for the world premiere of a reggae album.

“I am very excited to join the district, and can’t wait to see what this year brings! I would like to leave you with my favorite quote: “Music touches us emotionally, where words alone can’t.” ― Johnny Depp. Go Cardinals!”

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Clinton Schools has received confirmation that one of our student-athletes tested positive for COVID-19. The Henry County Health Department and/or the District has notified all families of students who had contact with the positive student making them aware of the possible exposure.

Meanwhile, the district has suspended the strength/conditioning and sports activities at the high school and middle school until further notice. We are in constant communication and are cooperating fully with the Henry County Health Department as they perform the necessary contact tracing and will continue to follow their guidance.

We will resume activities as soon as we are safely able.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

post_text:
Welcome to the family!

Clinton High School is looking forward to welcoming Sarah Armon to their school family this year. Ms. Armon will be teaching A.P. Psychology and Government as well as serving as the CHS Assistant Girls and Boys Tennis Coach.

Ms. Armon is originally from Grand Junction, Colorado and graduated from Colorado State University with a bachelor's degree in History. She brings six years of teaching experience to our Cardinals.

Sarah is the proud mom of four sons, the oldest of which is headed to college this fall. In her spare time she enjoys being active, tackling house projects and spending time with her two dogs.

"I am excited to work in the Clinton School District because I love the small town atmosphere. One of the reasons I left my prior town was the massive amounts of growth. I love that school really feels like a family and they are willing to really help each other out."

#CardinalPride

post_text:
SURVEY CLOSES TOMORROW, TUESDAY, JULY 7 @ 8PM

The Clinton School District is looking forward to beginning the 20-21 school year as scheduled, on Tuesday, August 25th.

As we work on re-entry planning and the steps we should take to keep our students, families, and staff safe, we have created a survey to gather feedback from parents/guardians on reopening this fall as well as insight on how Distance Learning worked for your family last spring. Please click on the image below to complete the survey.

Your feedback, as well as advice from local, state and national health officials, will be used to help us implement a thoughtful and methodical reopening plan that meets student instructional needs and the health concerns posed by COVID-19.

Thank you for your time and perspective on this important topic.

#CardinalPride

Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton Early Childhood Center Clinton Middle School Clinton High School

Kindergarten students in Mrs. Petry's summer school class are getting a head start on celebrating the 4th of July with Fireworks in a Jar!

This STEM project was a great way to get students excited and engaged in science. Students learned that the heavier colored drips sink to the bottom and make amazing patterns.

One student even exclaimed, “I feel like a scientist!”

Welcome to the family!

Clinton High School is looking forward to welcoming Amanda McKeehan to their school family this school year as an ELA (English Language Arts) teacher.

Mrs. McKeehan has a bachelor's degree from UCM and is bringing 11 years of teaching experience with her from the La Monte R-IV School District.

Amanda and her husband of 17 years have five children. In her free time, Amanda enjoys fostering animals for the Clinton Animal Shelter.

"I am excited to work for the Clinton School District because it is a new challenge and the people are amazing."

*There are no income or residency requirements.
*Distribution will occur at the east end of the football field.
*Please enter through the Clinton Middle School parking lot.
*If you are unable to make it to the distribution, please send someone to pick a box up for you, or you may call 885-2237.

post_text:
Welcome to the family!

The Clinton Early Childhood Center is excited to announce that Sandy Monteer will be joining their team as a Head Start Teacher this coming school year.

Mrs. Monteer, a CHS alum, has a bachelor's degree in Early Childhood and Elementary Education from UCM and a Masters of Art in Teaching from Columbia College. She has 15 years of teaching experience, 11 of those in early childhood education.

Sandy has been married for 20 years and is the proud mom of two grown sons, a daughter who is a student at UCM and a son who will be attending Clinton Middle School.

“I believe that all children can do amazing things, and my job is to find out the best way to inspire them. My favorite quote is from Albert Einstein, "It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.”

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Welcome to the Family!

Henry Elementary is excited to welcome Kayla Sherer as a 1st grade teacher this coming school year. Kayla will also serve as a cheerleading coach at CHS.

Ms. Sherer graduated from the University of Central Missouri with a Bachelor of Science degree in Early Childhood Education in December 2019. Since that time, she has worked as a Head Start teacher at CECC.

Kayla not only has a heart for kids, but also for animals. In her spare time she enjoys spending time with her 14 year old Yorkie, and 2 bottle-fed kittens.

"I am thrilled to return to Henry Elementary and have the opportunity to continue learning from the same teachers and staff who mentored me during my time as a student-teacher. My goal as a teacher and coach is to spread positivity and joy to students and peers both in and out of my classroom."

#CardinalPride

post_text:
8TH GRADE PROMOTION UPDATE

Important info and updates regarding 8th grade promotion and practice is below.

#CardinalPride
shared_text:
Clinton Middle School
June 19 at 1:06 PM ·

8th grade students and parents:

We have made a few changes to the upcoming Promotion ceremony:

*Masks are now optional to wear for practice and the ceremony.

*Seating has changed. Graduates will now sit in the home stands. Parents and families may sit on the field or in the visitor stands. There will be an area for handicapped seating, and an area marked off for picture taking. Please bring lawn chairs to sit in. We still ask that families sit together on the field.

*Don't forget: we will practice on Friday, June 26th at 5pm. We will start in the gym and move out to the stadium. We will have a cookout at the conclusion of practice.

*The gates will open at 8am for seating, and the ceremony will begin at 9am. If there is inclement weather, we will delay until the weather has passed. If this happens, please check our social media pages on FB and Twitter.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact the school office at 660-885-3353 or Ms. Paschall at jpaschall@clintoncardinals.org

We can't wait to see you and celebrate with you on Saturday, June 27th!

Graduation Updates as of 6/18 (see all updates at the link below)
https://clintoncardinals.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=4285651&pageId=27010736

*Seniors can request two additional tickets for the ceremony by contacting Kim Greer at the CHS office. We still have many Seniors who have not picked up their envelope of tickets.

*A decision on the 2pm or 7pm time will be made next week based on weather predictions for June 28th.

*Masks are now optional for those who would like to wear them, but will not be required. We do ask that families still sit together if possible.

*Practice will be next Friday, 6/26 at 9am for all Seniors. Please bring your gown with a hanger for formal pictures that will be taken indoors by Karen Keith. Gowns will be hung up and not worn during outdoor practice.

**Please watch next week for parking directions and entrance information as well as a decision regarding the 2pm or 7pm time for graduation.**

post_text:
The Clinton School District will be offering another Farmers to Families Food Box Distribution this morning (Tuesday, June 16th) from 9:00-11:00 at the east end of the football field (please enter through the middle school parking lot).

This week, there is a fruit and vegetable box, a dairy box, and possibly some prepared meat boxes with chicken nuggets, meatballs, etc.

You may pick up for other families when you go through the line. If you cannot come during the distribution time, you may have someone else pick up for you or you can contact Central Office at 660-885-2237.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Our buildings have been empty and much too quiet since March 13th.

But today the District was able to welcome students back for Summer School where there were lots of smiles and thumbs-up from students (and staff).

A few shout outs:
*Thanks to all of our parents for following our safety protocols and for performing self-screening assessments of their children every morning (these can be viewed on our website at the link below).
https://clintoncardinals.org/cms/one.aspx?pageId=5636621

*Thanks to all of our amazing staff who are providing great learning opportunities and fun for our students during these trying times. Many extra safety protocols have been put in place which calls for all hands on deck, and our staff have stepped up once again!

*Thanks to Bright Futures and other area businesses for donating refillable water bottles for students.

We look forward to a productive, fun and safe summer school experience!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
ATTENTION PARENTS OF 6TH GRADERS

Sixth grade strength and conditioning will begin Monday, June 15th, and will take place Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays from 9:00 - 9:45 am through July 31st.

When dropping off your students for strength and conditioning, we are still following Henry County Health Department recommendations.

*Please remain in your vehicle as you drop-off and pick-up your students.

*Drop-off and pick-up will be at the east end zone entrance/exit.

*All students will be socially distanced throughout workouts and also required to use hand sanitizer both when they arrive and before they depart.

*Due to the increasing temperatures, please ensure your student has a large water bottle with plenty of ice and water. The water access to the field will be limited to the restrooms.

Thank you for your participation and assistance with keeping all of our student-athletes as safe as we can.

If you should have any questions, please email Dr. Rob Anthony, ranthony@clintoncardinals.org.

#CardinalPride

Clinton Middle School

FREE SUMMER MEAL PROGRAM INFORMATION

Summer School starts on Monday, and with that will come changes to our free meal program.

If your child is not attending summer school and you would still like for them to receive free meals, you may continue to pick meals up at Henry Elementary from 11:00-12:00 Monday through Friday (no home deliveries will be able to be made).

When you arrive, please go to Henry Elementary's front doors and inform the secretary of how many meals you need and they will be brought to you.

The menu for the first two weeks of summer school is below.

post_text:
At Wednesday evening's Board of Education meeting, Clinton School District thanked Kyle Johnson for his service and leadership to the District as a member of the Board of Education for the past 3 years.

Board Secretary, Amanda Cothern, also administered the oath of office to board members who were elected on June 2nd. Ryan Parks is returning for his second term, Scott Bernard enters his first term of service and Susan Jones-Hard returns to the board for a fourth term.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Diplomas are being signed and graduation speakers have been announced, which means we're getting close to celebrating the Class of 2020!

The senior class has selected Mrs. Jamie McCoy to be their Faculty Speaker for the June 28th Ceremony. Mrs. McCoy is the Senior Counselor at CHS and has been with the Clinton School District for 5 years.

The Student Speaker for graduation this year will be Ms. Kendall Keithley. Kendall will graduate Summa Cum Laude with the Class of 2020 and has represented CHS in a variety of activities over the last 4 years. Ms. Keithley has been active in band, NHS, Volleyball as well as being a Missouri Girls State Delegate and Academic Excellence Recipient.

We look forward to celebrating with our seniors and their families on June 28th!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Welcome to the Family!

Henry Elementary is excited to welcome Brittany Couts as a 1st grade teacher beginning in the 20-21 school year.

Brittany was born and raised in Windsor, MO. She attended the University of Central Missouri and earned a degree in Early Childhood Education, with certification also in Elementary Education and Special Education. Ms. Couts has taught in the Montrose and Warsaw school districts.

Brittany and her two daughters, Harper and Kimber, enjoy rescuing animals and spending time in Colorado exploring and hiking.

Help us welcome Ms. Couts to to the Cardinal family!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
CHS Graduation Updates

**All graduation updates and info can be found on our website at the link below:
https://clintoncardinals.org/news/what_s_new/c_h_s_graduation_information**

* Seniors can begin picking up their tickets starting on June 8th as well as their NHS stoles and Latin Honor Cords.

* To receive their diploma on the day of graduation, Seniors will have to have all obligations/fines from the school taken care of. This can be done in the main office starting June 8th as well.

* Several students have caps/gowns, announcements and other items from Josten’s in the office as well to pick up.

* Students may decorate their graduation cap with approval from Dr. Steffens. Send a picture or screen shot of the design to jsteffens@clintoncardinals.org

* All Seniors need to plan to attend graduation practice on Friday, June 26th, 9am, at Clinton Middle School.

* Family and friends attending graduation need to make plans to bring their own chairs, audience will be on the turf for the ceremony.

Stay tuned for more updates as plans and logistics are finalized.

#CardinalPride

Clinton Early Childhood Center Head Start is now enrolling!

CECC Head Start is a free, full-day, needs-based preschool for 3-5 year olds.

If you are interested in enrolling your child in this program, please use the form at the link below.

Applications can also be picked-up and dropped-off at CECC this Wednesday, June 10 and Thursday, June 11 between 9:00am-3:30pm. When picking-up or dropping-off applications, please stay in your vehicle and call 660-885-5845 and a staff member will come to you.

Please direct all questions to Tori Wilson (towilson@clintoncardinals.org or 660-885-5845).

CECC HEAD START ENROLLMENT FORM: https://bit.ly/2Xao2ff

post_text:
Transportation routes for Summer School are now available on our website at the link below.
https://www.clintoncardinals.org/for_parents/summer_school/bus_routes_and_info

A few things to remember:
*Transportation is available for all students entering kindergarten-5th grade.

*Parents must have completed the online Summer School enrollment form for students to utilize bus transportation (letters confirming enrollment will arrive in mailboxes next week).

*Students must live within the Clinton School District and also live farther than a mile from the school to be able to utilize school bus transportation.

*Please remember that times are approximate and could be within 5 minutes of the time provided. Times on the left side of the document are morning pick-up times and times on the right side are afternoon drop-off times.

*If you should have any transportation-related questions, please call 660-885-2644.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
THANK YOU CLINTON!

The unofficial results indicate that the Clinton School District’s No-Tax Rate Increase Bond Issue has passed with 76.6% approval (57% was required).

We live in a very different world today than when our board placed this bond on the ballot in January. Even so, with the passage of this ballot measure, the citizens of our community made a strong statement that high-quality, safe and secure schools and facilities are important to Clinton.

With the passage of this bond, our work has just begun. Today you provided the District the green light to make necessary improvements to support student success. It will be our job as a district to be a good steward of your investment.

The District looks forward to providing regular updates to the community about the work being done to implement the 2020 bond.

Thank you again! It is a proud day to be a Cardinal!

#CARDINALPRIDE

You can vote on this, and other issues in our community, between 6:00am-7:00pm.

Learn more about the District's No-Tax Rate Increase Bond issue at www.clintoncardinals.org.

post_text:
We are 2 days away from the June 2nd municipal election.

Below is an example of how the Clinton School District's $4 million No-Tax Rate Increase Bond will appear on the ballot.

****If approved, the funds used for the projects below would have no impact on the district’s debt service tax levy.****

Polls will be open from 6:00am-7:00pm on Tuesday.

If you will be unable to make it to your polling location on Tuesday, you can cast an absentee ballot tomorrow, Monday, June 1st in the Henry County Clerk's Office (first floor of the Henry County Courthouse).

Want more info about the ballot issue? Visit www.clintoncardinals.org or call Central Office at 885-2237.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Unprecedented times call for unprecedented ideas and adjustments to the way things are usually done.

Today, Clinton High School helped celebrate and honor CHS senior, Spencer Jones who is leaving for basic training in two weeks and will not be able to attend the school's graduation ceremony on June 28th.

Congratulations Spencer, and way to go CHS for being committed to honoring and celebrating the Class of 2020!

#CardinalPride
shared_text:
Clinton High School
May 31 at 1:29 AM ·

Clinton High School Class of 2020 has its first official graduate! Spencer Storm Jones graduated today in a private ceremony on his family property. Spencer will be joining the Army and is headed to basic training in two weeks, therefore missing the CHS class of 2020’s graduation ceremony on June 28th.

Superintendent Destry Brown, Principal Jarrod Steffens, Counselor Jamie McCoy, and Teacher/Coach Ryan Guenther￼ joined family and friends for a ceremony to graduate Spencer.

Your Cardinal family says congrats and Good Luck! Thank you for your choice to serve our country!

Clinton Schools￼

Clinton High School Class of 2020 has its first official graduate! Spencer Storm Jones graduated today in a private ceremony on his family property. Spencer will be joining the Army and is headed to basic training in two weeks, therefore missing the CHS class of 2020’s graduation ceremony on June 28th.

Superintendent Destry Brown, Principal Jarrod Steffens, Counselor Jamie McCoy, and Teacher/Coach Ryan Guenther￼ joined family and friends for a ceremony to graduate Spencer.

Your Cardinal family says congrats and Good Luck! Thank you for your choice to serve our country!

Clinton Schools￼

post_text:
JUNE 2ND NO-TAX RATE INCREASE BOND---PROJECT HIGHLIGHT

The District's No-Tax Rate Increase Bond proposal provides for renovations and improvements to be made to existing school facilities.

The kitchen at Clinton Intermediate School is currently a “warming-kitchen” only, not allowing for food to be prepared on-site. The District's bond package will allow for the current kitchen to be upgraded to a full-working kitchen. The No-Tax Rate Increase Bond will also allow for the current office spaces at Henry Elementary and Clinton Intermediate School to be converted into classrooms, allowing for additional learning spaces for students. The proposal will also provide for improvements to be made to student restrooms and other school facilities.

As a reminder, the $4 million No-Tax Rate Increase Bond will have zero impact on the District's current debt service tax levy.

For more information please visit www.clintoncardinals.org.

#CardinalPride

Clinton Early Childhood Center Henry Elementary School Clinton Intermediate School Clinton High School The Clinton Daily Democrat KDKD News

post_text:
JUNE 2ND NO-TAX RATE INCREASE BOND---PROJECT HIGHLIGHT

Not only will the June 2nd No Tax-Rate Increase Bond allow the District to address the safety of students and staff during the school day, but it is also addressing the safety of those who visit our facilities.

The No-Tax Rate Increase Bond will fund the installation of handrails and add other safety features (closing gaps in between bleachers, adding fence, etc.) to the bleacher seating at Cardinal Stadium so the seating will meet current safety codes.

Improvements to the seating at Cardinal Stadium has been mentioned as a safety priority by community members.

The Clinton Daily Democrat

#CardinalPride

post_text:
JUNE 2ND NO-TAX RATE INCREASE BOND---PROJECT HIGHLIGHT

If you have visited Henry Elementary or Clinton Intermediate School, you have noticed that upon entry into the buildings there is no secure vestibule that restricts visitors from advancing past the office and into the rest of the building.

At the other schools in the District, visitors are confined within a vestibule and cannot access the rest of the school until someone in the office grants them access. Having a secure vestibule at Henry Elementary and Clinton Intermediate School was suggested as a needed improvement in a recent audit by Homeland Security and local law enforcement agencies.

Using the proceeds from the June 2nd $4,000,000 No-Tax Rate Increase Bond issue, will allow the district to provide Henry Elementary and Clinton Intermediate Schools with more secure and controlled entrances.

For more information please visit www.clintoncardinals.org

#CardinalPride

Greater Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce The Clinton Daily Democrat

As a reminder, meal distribution will continue through June 12th.

Meals can be picked-up Monday, Wednesday and Friday between 11:00-12:00 in the front circle drive at Henry Elementary. **Please note, no distribution will occur on Monday, May 25th due to the Memorial Day holiday**

If you have not signed your child up for meals, you can do so by calling Henry Elementary (885-5585).

Today, 132 CHS students would have walked across the stage to receive their diploma.

While their graduation ceremony has been delayed until June 28th, we wanted to honor them today.

All day long, we have dedicated this page to the CHS Class of 2020. Below are the last seven graduates to be featured (students who shared information with us were featured in the order the information was received).

Congrats to the Class of 2020!

post_text:
"The days are long, but the years are short"-Gretchen Rubin

In August of 2007, the 5 and 6 year olds pictured below began a journey that has taken them to today.....what would have been their last official day of high school.

Many of these students have spent the last 13 years together, and as a school district, we have had the joy of watching them learn and grow into young adults.

We thought you might enjoy seeing these students as we saw them 13 years ago.

**Parents, if you have a favorite picture of your senior from years gone by, please share it below!**

#CardinalPride #Classof2020

Clinton High School

post_text:
FEEL GOOD NEWS ALERT!

CSD teacher and track coach, Nathan Johnson shared this special story with us.

"In 2010, right before I started working in the CSD, I was training for triathlons and ran a 5k race in Chilhowee. During the race, I remember a little girl who was 7 or 8 years old running in the same race and she kept up with me for the first mile or so, and I was so impressed. This little girl was Abbie Dameron who is now a CHS senior. Abbie ran track her freshman year and was going to come back this season to end her high school career. I recently gave her the trophy I received from that 2010 race, with a little note on the bottom as a senior track gift since she couldn't run this season."

#CardinalPride
text:

post_text:
Today is School Nurse's Day.

Our district is fortunate to employ five of the best nurses around. Our school nurses are some of the most caring, compassionate, knowledgeable and kid-loving people you will ever meet.

We couldn't function as a school without them, and we are so glad to have them as part of our Cardinal family.

Left to right (top row): Rachel Vencill, LPN at Henry Elementary, Jana Matthes, Health Aide at CIS, and Nichole Houk, LPN at CMS

Left to right (bottom row): Bobbi Wilson, RN at CECC, and Julie Balke, RN at CHS

#CardinalPride

Clinton Schools
April 17 at 6:00 PM ·

YEARBOOK INFO FOR Henry Elementary School & Clinton Intermediate School:

If you are interested in ordering a yearbook for your Henry Elementary or CIS student, please stop by Henry Elementary's meal distribution line between the hours of 11:00-12:00 (Monday, Wednesday, and Friday) to pick-up a payment envelope. The cost of a yearbook is $15 (checks can be made out to PTO). Please return the envelope with your information on the front, in the food distribution line by May 6th.

Yearbooks will be printed this summer and passed out during Meet the Teacher Night in August.

#CardinalPride

ATTENTION ALL INCOMING KINDERGARTEN STUDENTS!

For planning purposes, it is very important that we identify all students who will be attending kindergarten in the Clinton School District during the 2020-2021 school year.

If your child will be 5 on or before July 31st please take a few minutes to complete the form below.

Not only will this form guide our planning for next school year, but it will enable our staff to contact you with information about kindergarten screening once that date is scheduled.

Please share this post with others.

FORM: https://forms.gle/eHPzA3XVmLbxaCVt8

post_text:
It's National Teacher Appreciation Week!

Throughout the week, we will feature teachers whom you have told us are making an impact on you or your child. As you read these shout-outs you will notice a common theme. Teachers do so much more than just "teach". They build relationships with students, help them feel safe and secure and love and care for them like they are their own. Our teachers are top-notch, and we truly believe we have the best teachers around!

Our first shout-out goes to CHS Science teacher, Gary Bowers.

#CardinalPride #ThankaMOTeacher

post_text:
We end our Healthcare Hero spotlights with a picture of a #CardinalHero who is helping to train future healthcare heroes!

Pictured below is 2002 CHS graduate, Cassie (Johnson) Foster. Cassie is an RN who is currently one of two Health Occupations instructors at Clinton Technical School.

"I continue to serve these students daily through distance learning. In the evenings I continue to educate adult learners and prepare them to become CNA-certified for Westwood Living Center in Clinton. I also work part-time on the weekends for GVMH on the Medical/Surgical floors. While taking of care patients, I'm also able to keep all of my nursing skills up to date and share these with all my students."

Thank you, Cassie!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
TEACHER APPRECIATION WEEK....THANK A TEACHER!

Never before have teachers been more appreciated, than during the COVID-19 crisis. Overnight, teachers learned how to "do school" in a whole new way. Our teachers rose to the occasion and have made us proud as they not only continued the learning process away from the school building, but continued to grow and nurture the relationships they had built all year long.

For Teacher Appreciation Week, May 4-8, we would like to give you the opportunity to show some love and appreciation to a CSD teacher who is making a special impact on you or your child.

If you would like to participate, please complete the form below and we will share your comments with our staff as a nice surprise during Teacher Appreciation Week. We will also feature a few on social media throughout the week.

If you have any questions, please email alawson@clintoncardinals.org.

The deadline for completing the form is May 7th.

#CardinalPride #ThankATeacher

DOCS.GOOGLE.COM

post_text:
Thank you to 2002 CHS graduate, Kayleen Thomas who is serving in healthcare during the COVID-19 pandemic. Kayleen has 12 years experience as an Emergency Room nurse, but is currently providing staff development at Western Missouri Medical Center. During the COVID-19 crisis, Kayleen's roles include; screening staff members for symptoms, ordering testing, monitoring employees who are on quarantine, and determining when these staff can return to work. "It's been a very scary few weeks for my team here, but we've adapted well and are doing what we need to do for our community. Everyone stay safe, stay home, and stay well!!"

#CardinalPride #CardinalHeroes

post_text:
Henry Elementary School Cardinals......assistant principal, Jake Kenney misses you and wanted to show you his new work space in today's #DeskOfTheDay feature.

"Hey Cardinal Family! I miss you! My new desk isn’t as fun as it is at school. I am constantly being disrupted by LEGO-building, playing Toy Story with my boys and homework with the girls! Which isn’t all that bad, but I miss my students! I’m working hard and zooming with students and teachers daily! I love seeing your faces, even if it’s not in person! I can’t wait for the day that I get to see you and hug you! Stay safe and enjoy the weather on the nice days and on the cold days I hope you find time to snuggle up and watch a great movie. Our number one activity here has been LEGO building competitions! If you have any amazing creations you’ve made, I’d love to see them! Shoot me an email: jkenney@clintoncardinals.org. Or if you just want to chat, I’d love to hear from you! I miss you, Cardinal Nation! Stay strong, stay healthy! #cardinalstrong"

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome

post_text:
YEARBOOK INFO FOR Henry Elementary School & Clinton Intermediate School:

If you are interested in ordering a yearbook for your Henry Elementary or CIS student, please stop by Henry Elementary's meal distribution line between the hours of 11:00-12:00 (Monday, Wednesday, and Friday) to pick-up a payment envelope. The cost of a yearbook is $15 (checks can be made out to PTO). Please return the envelope with your information on the front, in the food distribution line by May 6th.

Yearbooks will be printed this summer and passed out during Meet the Teacher Night in August.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
GOOD NEWS ALERT!

Congratulations to CHS English teacher, Shasta Hetherington who was recognized as the Missouri State Teacher Association's (MSTA) Secondary Educator of the Year for the Central Region. The MSTA’s Central Region includes more than ninety public school districts

Shasta is a proud wife of Jack and mother to three amazing children; Tara, Megan, and Owen. Shasta was born and raised in Clinton where she has taught English for the past five years both at the middle school and high school levels, as well as a 3rd grade teacher at Leeton Elementary for four years. While a CSD educator, Shasta helped to adopt the National Junior Honor Society at CMS, was the middle school yearbook advisor, and now serves as the National Honor Society sponsor for CHS.

Mrs. Hetherington graduated from Central Methodist University with a Bachelor’s in Education and also holds a Master’s in Educational Leadership from the University of Central Missouri. She is also a member of Kappa Delta Pi, Delta Epsilon Iota, and the National Society of Leadership and Success.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Let's show some Cardinal love to CHS alum, Leslie Hunter who is serving on the front lines during the COVID-19 pandemic. Leslie is a 2013 graduate of CHS and is a Trauma Certified-Critical Care Registered Nurse in the ICU department at Research Medical Center, and is working in the Medical ICU-COVID Unit. "It’s terrifying, yet so important to do the work I do. It’s a privilege to be there for these patients at the scariest times of their lives. These are pictures from our COVID Unit. We are on week seven of this horrible disease. I want to reach out to the younger community about how important it is to protect each other by social distancing ourselves."

Are you, or someone you know, a CSD graduate who is serving as a healthcare worker during the COVID-19 pandemic? We would love to recognize you/them! Please email alawson@clintoncardinals.org for more info.

#CardinalPride #CardinalHeroes

post_text:
For many of our staff members, their new work spaces often include office assistants (aka, their own kiddos)! First grade teacher, Mrs. Powell wants to give you a tour of her new classroom in today's #DeskOfTheDay feature.

"Hello students & families and welcome to Mrs. Powell’s desk and office space at home! My desk reminds me a lot of the flexible seating in our first grade classroom, because I am always changing where I want to work on things. I love to stand and type because I feel so much more energized, but I love to sit at our kitchen table when doing Zoom meetings. I also have three magnificent office assistants that are busy doing their school activities as well! Our first grade team has been working so hard on creating take home learning packets as well as making sure our students have lots of online learning projects and materials to access for additional learning and extension activities. I miss our Cardinals so much and hope everyone has a great week!"

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome

post_text:
Beginning tonight, and continuing every Friday night until May 15th, the lights at Cardinal Stadium will be turned on at 20:20 (8:20pm) and stay on for 20 minutes in honor of the Class of 2020. You can also tune in here tonight at 8:20 for a video.

This national movement is a reminder to the Class of 2020 to #BeTheLight, regardless of the circumstances.

This is not meant as an event to "attend". Please only drive-by and honk. To ensure the safety of everyone and to follow social distancing guidelines, please do not get out of your vehicles or come with others who are not in your immediate family. It is important that we follow all guidelines put in place to keep us safe.

You can hear more about this event here: https://twitter.com/Cardinal_AD/status/1248663607363002368

#CardinalPride #ClassOf2020

post_text:
Today, Missouri Governor, Mike Parson ordered that all Missouri public schools will remain closed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year to flatten the curve and slow the spread of COVID-19.

At this time, there are a number of questions regarding what ending the school year looks like for the Clinton School District. While we do not have all of the answers right now, here is what we do know:
*Buildings will remain closed
*Distance learning (both online and hard copy formats) will continue through May 15th
*Our meal distribution program will continue as well

We know this announcement brings with it many questions. As we are able to work through this announcement, solidify the unknowns, and explore our options we will communicate with you. Please continue to follow our social media outlets, our website and watch for emails from the school.

As we have said since this began, we appreciate your patience and partnership as we navigate through these unprecedented times.

Together we will get through this.

#CardinalPride

Parents, thank you, thank you, thank you for your support throughout our school closure.

We know that you're stumbling through this new routine as much as we are, and we want to acknowledge that and let you know how much it means that our school community has come together so tightly over the past few weeks.

So give yourself a pat on the back tonight, get a good night's sleep, and know that we're in this together.

COVID-19 Grading Policy Update:

The purpose of grading at all times, is feedback. This feedback gives information to the student to know how they are learning and to the teacher to drive instruction. This underlying purpose will continue even during our crisis learning that has changed the learning process for everyone.

Throughout our COVID-19 school closure, each building will follow the guidelines and policies located on our COVID-19 Grading Policy webpage. This webpage can be found by going to www.clintoncardinals.org and clicking on the COVID-19 banner image, or by using the link below.

https://clintoncardinals.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=4285651&pageId=26596682

If you should have any questions regarding these policies, please reach out to your child's school principal.

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome

post_text:
Cardinals....don't you love getting a "behind the scenes" look into your teachers' new work spaces? Today we share CHS Biology teacher, Mr. Tennal's new "classroom".

"This is a high traffic area for the Tennal family for work, research, and play. There is typically always someone in this room at any given time of the day or night."

"I use the main PC to build my lesson plans using several resources from AP classroom, Bozeman Science, USA Test Prep, NGSS, Howard Hughes Medical Institute, and Quizizz."

"I'm staying in contact with my students via email, "live" video lectures, Q/A sessions etc. I also visit with students and their parents via Zoom, Facetime, or any other collaboration method they are comfortable with."

"I included pictures of my partners in distance learning. They are always just a few feet away from me while I'm working".

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome

EXTENDED SCHOOL CLOSURE UPDATE:

The CSD Board of Education has extended the current school closure through April 17th.

Please know, this may be readjusted depending on a possible announcement by Governor Parson later this week. The Board realizes that there is a real possibility that schools could be closed at least through the end of April. The Board believes it is in the best interest of our students and community to reassess the situation every two weeks.

As always, stay informed by following our social media outlets and our COVID-19 Info and Update page located at the link below.

"I became pen pals with a student from Australia when I was in 6th grade as part of the USPS Olympic Pen Pal Club. We met one another (and our spouses) for the first time in person the summer of 2006 when she and her husband came to the US to visit. We continue to be great friends today!"

post_text:
Good News Alert!

Each year Osage Valley Electric Cooperative sponsors a contest to select two area high school juniors to represent the cooperative on the National Rural Electric Youth Tour, an exciting all-expenses paid trip to Washington DC in June! Delegates from across Missouri enjoy a week of sightseeing, learning and fun!

Congratulations to CHS junior, Lydia Harrison who was chosen as one of only 100 Missouri students for this great experience.

Lydia also won a $500 grant for Clinton High School.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Today's "Desk of the Day" comes to us from Clinton Middle School special education teacher, Ms. Halbrook.

"I have set-up my "work-from-home-space" in my kitchen. As you can see, my co-worker, Daisy, enjoys having me home. I am providing both on-line lessons and traditional paper lessons for my Reading and ELA students. Each student will be able to choose which format they prefer. I also will be phoning each of my students on Monday and Wednesday of each week to see how they are doing and what questions they might have. Please feel free to email me or call me during this unique time. I’d love to help you in any way I can."

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome #DeskOfTheDay

post_text:
Mr. Rogers said it best....

"When I was a boy and I would see scary things in the news, my mother would say to me....Look for the helpers, you will always find people who are helping."

Yesterday, school staff provided meals to 430 children in our community. This free meal service will continue throughout the duration of our school closure.

If you are interested in your child participating, and have not completed the survey, please use the link below to do so. Please only indicate the days you intend to pick up a meal as it helps food service staff prepare the appropriate number of meals.

SURVEY: https://forms.gle/uHzJ9Zr4i4aaQLXr7

More info about the meal service program can be found on our website.

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome

post_text:
Our teachers, administrators and staff may not be able to "be at work", but they are still working!

We thought you might like to see what their new work spaces look like. Plus, we know you miss their smiling faces!

We will be featuring a "Desk of the Day" here on Facebook to show you what our staff's new work spaces look like, as well as tell you a little more about how they're staying in touch with students.

Today, we bring you Henry Elementary Title I Reading Teacher, Mrs. Steinbach.

"Hey all! I’m getting ready to send out letters to my kiddos. In the story of “Dear Mr. Blueberry”, by Simon James, a little girl, Emily, writes letters back and forth to her teacher. So, my dog Char-Char and I are going to get busy writing friendly letters in the hopes that we might get a letter or an e-mail back."

#CardinalPride #CardinalsAtHome #DeskOfTheDay

post_text:
Oh, Cardinals....we miss you!

Spring Break looked a little different for CSD staff this year. Like you, staff spent most of their time in their homes with their family. But staff were also busy preparing for how school will look come next week.

Staff took part in virtual meetings, prepared lesson plans in a way they never have before, read books to their students, and more than anything missed their students!

Even though school won't look the same next week, we want to stay in touch with our students and families. Watch for some ways we plan to put some fun into our current situation!

#CardinalPride #ClintonCardinalsAtHome

PUBLIC NOTICE:

In an effort to take as many safety precautions as possible during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Clinton Board of Education will hold their regular Board of Education Meeting, scheduled for Monday, March 23, 2020 at 6:00 p.m., electronically.

We invite the public to view this videoconference Board meeting via Zoom. Please access the meeting through the following URL: https://zoom.us/j/220834138.

You can view the full public notice below.

post_text:
POSTPONED!

The 2020 Father-Daughter Ball has been postponed.

When we are able to determine when we could reschedule, we will let you know.

Thank you for understanding!
shared_text:
Clinton Schools
March 8 at 10:00 PM ·

POSTPONED!

The 2020 "From a Father’s Heart Charity Ball ~ Under The Sea" will be held on Saturday, April 4th from 5:30 to 8:00 p.m. at the Benson Center.

Beginning on March 23rd, tickets can be purchased at the Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce, Cummings Menswear, and the Clinton Early Childhood Center. Ticket prices are $20.00 per father and daughter (ages 3-12), then an additional $5.00 for an additional daughter. The tickets include a professional photograph and a CD with favorite songs. Tickets are limited.

For more information, or to make a donation, please contact the Clinton School District at 885-2237.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
ATTENTION VOLUNTEERS!

The District is putting plans in place here at school to protect our students, staff and community from the threat of coronavirus. While there have been no confirmed cases in our community, we are acting out of an abundance of caution and are having to cease volunteering in our schools at this time.

Currently we do not know when we can allow volunteers to re-enter, but will communicate that as soon as we know.

We appreciate all that our volunteers do for our schools and we will miss having you, but please know this decision was made in the best interest of our students, staff and community.

Thank you for understanding.

Thank you for understanding.

POSTPONED!

The 2020 "From a Father’s Heart Charity Ball ~ Under The Sea" will be held on Saturday, April 4th from 5:30 to 8:00 p.m. at the Benson Center.

Beginning on March 23rd, tickets can be purchased at the Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce, Cummings Menswear, and the Clinton Early Childhood Center. Ticket prices are $20.00 per father and daughter (ages 3-12), then an additional $5.00 for an additional daughter. The tickets include a professional photograph and a CD with favorite songs. Tickets are limited.

For more information, or to make a donation, please contact the Clinton School District at 885-2237.

post_text:
Relationships first!

This week, CMS has been participating in the national Say Something "Call to Action" week through the Sandy Hook Promise Foundation.

Students have been taking part in activities that help them learn how to look for warning signs, signals and threats, especially on social media from someone who may be threatening to hurt themselves or others. On Wednesday, the emphasis was on students identifying their "Trusted Adult."

Throughout the year, CMS has been focusing on the importance of students having a trusted adult in their life through programs such as Signs of Suicide and Sandy Hook Promise programs. As you can see, students and teachers at CMS have formed close bonds and many students were able to identify trusted adults in the building.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
CHS students in Mr. Tennal's Wildlife Biology class are learning that there is more to wildlife management than animals.

In this recent lab, students measured the diameter of a large tree, than measured the diameter of the first tree to the north, east, south, and west. This gives students an idea of how old growth has an impact on the growth of new trees.

In the second part of this lab, students will participate in a tree inventory and identification lab.

#CardinalPride

Moving somewhere new can be daunting. But becoming part of the Cardinal family makes it a whole lot easier. Bethany Pierce teaches English II, Photography, Media Productions, and Yearbook at CHS and shares why she is glad she made the decision to join our team in this week's
#WednesdayWhy.

"This year and last year, my administrators and co-workers have been nothing but supportive, kind, and helpful. Beginning my teaching career in the CSD is one of the best decisions I have ever made. I love what I teach, who I teach, and my incredible coworkers. I moved here alone from Alabama and the CSD staff became my family."

The clock is ticking!

The deadline to register to vote in the April 7th election is ONE WEEK FROM TODAY, March 11th.

Registering is very simple, and can be done online at the link below, or in the Henry County Clerk's Office (first floor of the Henry County Courthouse).
REGISTER: https://www.sos.mo.gov/elections/goVoteMissouri/register

Also, absentee voting is open for those not able to go to their polling location on election day. Find more info about how to cast an absentee ballot below.
ABSENTEE VOTING INFO: https://www.henrycomo.com/absentee-voting

If you would like more information about the District's April 7th No-Tax Increase Bond Issue, visit www.clintoncardinals.org.

post_text:
Cherry pies, blue corduroy jackets, and green hands.....it can only mean one thing....it was National FFA Week!

The Clinton FFA organization had fun celebrating National FFA Week, but also took time to thank those in the community who support their efforts and program throughout the year.

Students began their week with "Greenhand Initiation". First-year FFA members had their hand dyed green to signify that they are "Greenhands". To celebrate George Washington's birthday, students delivered cherry pies to local businesses as a way to say "thank you". And on Thursday, students were up bright and early for their annual "FFA Supporter and Businessperson Breakfast" at Clinton High School.

Last week, students traveled to Kansas City, MO for the Western Farm Show.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Developing a culture of excellence is a priority in the Clinton School District. When these high levels of achievement and expectations are attained, it's important for us to recognize it.

At Monday evening's Board of Education meeting, the district recognized Clinton Middle School students who are achieving excellence in their academics.

Picture 1: 6th graders, Gavin Tirey and Ethan Williams (not pictured, Madalin Gaul)

Picture 2: 7th graders, Xavier Mason and Lucas Heredia (not pictured, Sloan Roberts)

Picture 3: 8th graders, Breanna Williams, Kaydith Maddox, and Kayla McCanles (not pictured, Shylen Beebe)

The District also recognized CHS Guidance Counselor, Jaime McCoy, for being a part of this year's College Board Counselor Recognition Program. Jamie was one of only seven Missouri counselors who received this award for her exemplary work as a professional school counselor.

The VFW recognized CHS teacher, Kristin Bailey, and Henry Elementary teacher, Allison Olson, for their promotion of citizenship education in their classrooms and schools.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Future engineers are hard at work in Mrs. Hill's Project Lead the Way Introduction to Engineering Design class.

Intro to Engineering Design is a new class offered at CHS this year. In this class, students are introduced to the engineering profession and a common approach to the solution of engineering problems, an engineering design process. Utilizing the activity-project-problem-based teaching and learning pedagogy, students progress from completing structured activities to solving open ended projects and problems that require them to develop planning, documentation, communication, and other professional skills.

The high school is excited to offer additional Project Lead the Way classes next year.

#CardinalPride

Thank you to the District's many industry partners who help make this event possible. Thank you to Golden Valley Memorial Healthcare, Gregg Smith Ford Lincoln, Champion Brands, LLC Hi-Tech Lubricants and State Fair Community College for presenting information to students and for sponsoring the event.

Additional support was also received from the Equity Bank, OakStar Bank, Hawthorn Bank, Full Line Lumber, Glasscock Enterprises and Schreiber Foods.

post_text:
Absentee voting for the April 7th election, begins today, Tuesday, February 25th.

Registered voters can cast an absentee ballot until Monday, April 6th, in the Henry County Clerk's Office (located on the first floor of the Henry County Courthouse).

Individuals can also write a letter for an absentee ballot to be mailed to them (phone requests are not permitted). If voting by mail, the ballot must be notarized prior to being mailed back to the Henry County Clerk's Office.

If you have additional questions about absentee voting, please contact the Henry County Clerk's Office, 660-885-7204.

ALSO, remember that if you aren't registered to vote, you have until March 11th to do so!

#CardinalPride

The Clinton Daily Democrat Greater Clinton Area Chamber of Commerce KDKD News
