The Clinton Middle School Jr Optimist Club recently delivered Valentine treats to our community's first responders. Students visited the Clinton Missouri Police Department, Clinton, Missouri Fire Department, Henry County Sheriff's Office and Henry County 911 Emergency Communications to show their appreciation.

Junior Optimist International, the youth component of Optimist International, is one of the world's largest service club organizations.

post_text:
A new initiative in the CSD is putting more technology into classrooms!

Teachers across the district who complete the Google Level 1 Educator Program, and are able to show how the integration of technology into their classroom will benefit students and supplement their teaching, are able to receive a classroom set of Chromebooks.

Congrats to 2nd grade teachers, Ms. Houk, Mrs. Briggs and high school teacher, Mrs. Daniel to be the first three teachers to receive their certification and receive this new technology. Several other teachers in the District have also completed their certification.

"With this initiative-based program, we don't waste money, time and effort on pushing technology onto a teacher who doesn't need it or want it. Our program also does not introduce a technology fee, which most standard programs require. We believe this program will maximize impact on student learning while using our resources responsibly", says Donnie Sage, CSD's Director of Technology.

#CardinalPride

In this week's #WednesdayWhy, Jessica Heggestad, the District's food service director, shares with us why she enjoys being a Cardinal.

"The best part of being a Cardinal is being part of this awesome school district. Being a Cardinal means being part of a team, a family that works together to put the needs of our students first."

post_text:
The Clinton Technical School Chapter of SkillsUSA recently competed in the West Central SkillsUSA Competition. Students from Clinton High School and 8 area high schools represented the Clinton chapter. These students took part in written tests, skills competitions, leadership and occupationally-related competitions.

The Clinton SkillsUSA Chapter had a very successful competition with 52 students moving on to compete in the state competition later this spring (see results in images below).

SkillsUSA is a very successful national student organization that is recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and the U.S. Department of Labor as a "successful model of employer-driven youth development".

Congrats to our students and their instructors.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Thanks to Henry Elementary School's Bright Futures partner, Golden Valley Memorial Healthcare, for providing a great experience for 120 2nd graders at last week's 5th annual Mini MASH Camp.

Second graders rotated through 6 different stations as they learned about germs, CPR, the composition of their blood, bones and more. During the process, students also had the chance to hear about the many different jobs at the hospital.

Thank you GVMH for providing this fun and educational field trip right here in our hometown!

#CardinalPride

post_text:
IMPORTANT INFO FOR CIS AND HENRY FAMILIES

The district has utilized all of their built-in calendar hours for school closures. With the last weather-related school closure on February 13th, the district must begin making up hours missed.

Beginning on Tuesday, February 18th, Henry Elementary and Clinton Intermediate School, will be increasing their start times by 10 minutes. CIS will begin classes at 8:05 and Henry Elementary at 8:10 (doors at both buildings will still open at 7:30 and morning bus pick-up times will remain the same). The district's other buildings already attend school 10 minutes longer than Henry and CIS, thus their start times will not be affected.

Adding minutes to the school day allows the district to make-up the minutes missed, without adding additional days to the end of the calendar.

Please remember that the new start times mentioned above will also be the start times for Henry and CIS during the 2020-2021 school year.

If you have any questions, please contact your child's school principal.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Congratulations to the CHS Speech Team, who had a great day at the Cole Camp Speech Tournament last weekend.

The team competed against 15 other schools and received 3rd place overall! Five competitors made it to finals in 6 events.

Congratulations to Kali Lindsay for 1st place in Original Oratory, Brooke LaFavor who earned 1st place in Extemporaneous Speaking and Aidin Hinkle who received 3rd place in Humorous Interpretation. Olivia Dawson made it to finals in Poetry and Hannah Harrelson in Dramatic Interpretation.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
FAST FACT!

Did you know that you have one more month to register to vote in the April 7th election?

The deadline to register to vote is one month from today, Wednesday, March 11th.

Need To Register to Vote?
*Register online at this link: https://www.henrycomo.com/registering-to-vote
*Register at the County Clerk's office (first floor of the Henry County Courthouse)
*Register by mail through a post-card registration application (postcards available at the County Clerk's office)
*Register at any Department of Motor Vehicles office, or state agency providing a service to the public (WIC, Social Services, etc)

Not Sure if you are Registered?
Check here: https://s1.sos.mo.gov/elections/voterlookup/

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Less than a week left to get your card!

From January 29th-February 10th students at Clinton Intermediate School and Henry Elementary will be selling these great little discount cards. You can also go here, https://www.majorsaver.com/cards/, to purchase a card online.

All proceeds from the sale of these cards directly support the Education Foundation for Clinton Students Inc. Since 2008, over $103,000 has been raised through the sale of Major Saver cards.

The Education Foundation for Clinton Students Inc. funds many projects in Clinton School District classrooms that fall slightly beyond funded activities and budget limitations.

These cards are a great way to support the school district, while also saving a little cash yourself.

#CardinalPride

Students in Mrs. Himes' kindergarten class used a number of different strategies during a recent math lesson.

Students measured their classmates' height with paper clips, counted the clips and then compared the results.

Lots of great collaboration and number talk happening during this lesson!

#CardinalPride

Lots of great collaboration and number talk happening during this lesson!

Congratulations to the students pictured below who are Students of the Month for January.

post_text:
It's time for another #WednesdayWhy. This week we visited with CHS senior, Madi Combs and asked her to tell us why she enjoys being a Cardinal and why she feels the CSD has prepared her for her next step in life.

"I enjoy attending school in Clinton because it feels like one big family....it's a home away from home. I know that everyone here is willing to help me, and relationships are a priority in this school. I believe that the variety of classes that are offered, especially the dual credit classes, have helped give me a jump start on college. I know that the teachers here truly care about my success as a student."

#CardinalPride

The Clinton School District, Bright Futures and the University Extension Office invite parents of CSD students to register for these free classes.

Introductory Class: February 4th, 4:00-6:00 at Henry Elementary

Six-Week Series of Classes: April 6, 13, 20, 27, May 4 and 11, 4:30-6:30 at Henry Elementary (see flyer below for more details).

**Participants receive a bag of free groceries each week of the 6-week series of classes.**

**Participants who attend all classes will receive a free crockpot**

If you would like to register, please email Angie Lawson (alawson@clintoncardinals.org) or call 885-5585 on Tuesday.

Don't delay, as class size is limited.

post_text:
Congratulations to the 60 Clinton Middle School 7th and 8th graders who met the requirements to become a member of the National Junior Honor Society.

In a ceremony held this week in Clinton High School's Performing Arts Center, friends and family celebrated these students' special accomplishment.

To be a member of this prestigious organization, students must maintain a GPA of 3.25, demonstrate leadership skills at school and in the community, be a good citizen and role model to peers, as well as complete 8 hours of community service.

Congratulations are also in order to this year's NJHS officers:
President-Kaitlynn Bartholomew
Vice-President-Ava Potter
Secretary-Kaydith Maddox
Treasurer-Harley Lincoln
Historian-Paige McNabb and Raylen Richman

Clinton Middle School NJHS advisers are, Angie Bremer and Erin Houk.

#CardinalPride

Hands-on learning is happening in Mrs. Briggs' 2nd grade classroom!

Students recently had the opportunity to dissect owl pellets. Students had fun using detective skills to determine what the owls had eaten. Thank you to Kristi Kenney for supplying and helping with this fun activity!

**Fun fact......Owls usually swallow their food whole, digest the edible parts, and then expel the indigestible parts through their mouth as a pellet.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
FROM THE NURSE'S OFFICE

It is that time of year when we start seeing more illnesses in our students. We just want to remind our families when students need to stay home.

*Students need to stay home if they have a fever of 100.0 or greater.

*They should not return to school until they are fever-free for 24 hours without fever-reducing medication.

*Students need to stay home if they are having diarrhea and vomiting and should not return until they have had 24 hours of no vomiting or diarrhea

*Sometimes your doctor will recommend your child stay home longer for certain illnesses. Please follow your doctor's advice.

*If your student stays home sick, please call their school office to notify them.

This is a great time to remind students to wash their hands and use hand sanitizer often and to keep their hands away from their eyes, mouth and nose. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact your child's school nurse.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
As promised, we are excited to bring you the CSD's Top 10 Facebook posts of 2019! These are the posts that you loved the most.

Coming in at #10 is a post with a theme that you will notice several times throughout this year's countdown.

Our district and community loves and supports our law enforcement agencies. The tulips planted at all schools is a yearly reminder of the sacrifice that officers make for our safety.

This post reached 6,409 people!

#CardinalPride #CardinalCountdown2019
shared_text:
Clinton Schools
April 12, 2019 at 10:00 PM ·

Spring has sprung.

135 tulips were planted at all schools last fall in memory of the 135 fallen officers who lost their lives in the line of duty in 2017. In the last few weeks, students have enjoyed watching the tulips they planted bloom.

This tulip campaign was sponsored by the Henry County Honor Coalition and was in conjunction with Red Ribbon Week.

#CardinalPride

Another plaque has been added to Clinton High School's Academic Wall of Fame.

This new plaque recognizes all students who have scored a 3 or higher on Advanced Placement (AP) exams. Advanced Placement classes were added two years ago, and help students prepare for post-secondary level coursework with the opportunity to also receive college credit.

CHS currently offers five AP classes, with plans to to add more in the coming years.

post_text:
Thirty-two Clinton Intermediate School students recently participated in their school's first-ever "Math Challenge Tournament".

The hour-long competition took place last week at CIS. Students volunteered to participate and competed against students from across the nation. Students participated in both mental math problems without scratch paper, and problem solving questions in which they were allowed to use paper to compute their answers. Prior to the competition, students were given practice tests to work on at home with their families.

All answer sheets have been sent for scoring. The top 10% in each grade level will be announced at the end of January. If a student is in the top 10% they will be invited to the Masters Round this spring.

**CIS Families**
To help your child with their math skills, CIS has a "Math Challenge" bulletin board that contains two weekly challenges. You can find CIS' weekly challenges (and answers to the previous challenges) at the following link: https://www.mathinaction.org/schools.html.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
It's important to "be in the know" when it comes to inclement weather and school closures.

When weather forces us to alter our school day in the form of an early dismissal, late start, or cancellation, the methods below are the modes of communication the district will use to inform you of this decision.

*DOWNLOAD OUR APP (Search for "Clinton School District" on Google Play or the Apple App Store. When school must close due to inclement weather, you will receive push notifications directly to your phone!)

*PHONE CALL/TEXT MESSAGE/EMAIL (You will only receive phone calls and text messages if we have your current contact information on file. Please provide your current phone numbers and emails to the office. Also, you must opt-in to receive text messages. Text "Y" to 67587.)

*FACEBOOK/TWITTER (Follow us on both platforms to stay informed. Facebook-"Clinton Schools" Twitter-@ClintonMoCards)

*NEWS MEDIA (School closing information will also be provided to KDKD and Kansas City news stations)

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Congratulations to Clinton High School senior, Levi Morris who was selected to participate in the 2019-2020 Blue-Grey All-American Bowl in Tampa Bay, Florida at the Buccaneers Raymond James Stadium.

Levi recently attended the Blue-Grey Heartland Football Combine at Missouri Western University, the camp and practice site for the Kansas City Chiefs. His performance earned him an invite to the Blue-Grey All-American Super Combine in which he attended in Canton, Ohio, home of the National Football League Hall of Fame.

Levi was selected to play the linebacker position for the Blue-Grey North Squad. Levi was 1 of 55 selected from over 6,000 players.

The Blue-Grey All-American Bowl game will be played on January 4th at 1:30pm and will be televised on ESPN3 live from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers’ Raymond James Stadium.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Clinton High School was featured in the Fall 2019 issue of "Access" magazine. This quarterly publication is produced by the Launch program that the district utilizes for virtual instruction.

The Launch program has allowed the CSD to expand course offerings and is currently being used by over 200 students. According to CHS Principal, Jarrod Steffens, "Launch is helping us equalize opportunities for students at smaller, rural districts in Missouri, like us. There are some things we can't offer because we just don't have enough students interested in it. We can't offer a course if only two kids want it. But Launch helps us with this."

#CardinalPride

Bright Futures Clinton needs your help!

There are still over 100 children on the Angel Tree that need to be adopted, and the deadline is December 16th.

Three Ways to Help:

*Adopt an Angel at, Crave Boutique, Ben Franklin's Bistro, Premiere Tanning or Cato.

*No time to shop? Donate towards an adoption and the shopping will be done for you! You can take a donation to any Hawthorn Bank location, or donate securely online at www.clintonangeltree.com.

*Share this post!

Barb Houk has been a teacher in the Clinton School District for 25 years. Hundreds of Health Occupations students have had the opportunity to learn from this amazing educator. In this week's #WednesdayWhy, Mrs. Houk shares her reason for teaching in the CSD.

"I am a Clinton graduate.....I have lived in this community since I was a senior in high school. My number one reason for teaching in the Clinton School District is because I love teaching.....especially the profession of healthcare to my students."

post_text:
This week, the district welcomed 600+ parents and special guests into their schools for the 2nd annual Cardinal Thanksgiving.

It was an amazing event that called for all hands on deck. A special thank you to all of our families that were able to join us. Thank you also to our amazing food service department who prepared and served all of the meals. Thank you to our staff who pitched in and helped wherever it was needed. Thank you to Cardi Guard volunteers and CMS students who helped as well.

If you were able to join us, let us know in the comments below!

#CardinalPride #CardinalThanksgiving2019

WOW!

Shout-out to our Cardinals who really came through for our community last week! Students participated in the annual district-wide food drive to benefit The Samaritan Center's, "Project Christmas Cheer".

DEADLINE IS TOMORROW, Tuesday, November 19th!

Your child’s school will be serving their Thanksgiving meal on the dates and times listed below and you are invited to join your child(ren) for lunch. Adult lunches for the Thanksgiving meal are $3.00.

To help kitchen staff prepare, YOU MUST RSVP BY TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 19th. Please see details on the image below regarding RSVP procedures (CECC, Henry, and CIS parents, if you need a money envelope and RSVP form, please contact your child's school).

Please be aware that to ensure the safety of our students and staff, all guests are asked to bring a photo ID to present when signing-in at the school.

We are very excited to welcome you into our school for a special meal with your child. If you have additional questions, please call your child’s school.

post_text:
Students in Mrs. Harrison's 8th grade social studies class have been studying the three branches of government.

Students were assigned the task of using the powers of the legislative, executive and judicial branches to create a new Clinton Middle School. Students worked in groups to design a new school, create new rules, and decide who would enforce and interpret these new rules.

Each group submitted their new school design to principal, Ms. Paschall, who reviewed all plans, provided feedback and chose the winning plans.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Kindergarten students are learning all about measurement.

This week, Mrs. Potter's students used non-standard units of measurement to determine how tall they were. Students counted to determine how many bears tall they, their classmates and their teacher were.

After collecting this data, students learned how to compare the different measurements as they lined up shortest to tallest.

#CardinalPride

post_text:
Clinton Middle School counselor, Sara Vaughn, and school librarian, Lisa Allen, presented this week at the Missouri School Counselor's Association Conference.

Their presentation was called, "The Dynamic Duo: Getting Teens Involved One Club at a Time".

Mrs. Vaughn and Mrs. Allen presented to school counselors from all over the state on the Book/Lunch Club that they implemented at CMS. Their workshop helped participants learn how together they met students' social and emotional needs while also developing lifelong readers.

post_text:
Last week, CSD students celebrated Red Ribbon Week. Red Ribbon Week is a national campaign that encourages children and youth across the nation to always make healthy choices, which includes avoiding drugs and alcohol.

Henry Elementary students participated in a Red Ribbon Week poster contest. Pictured below are the three students who won the contest (Rhylynn B, River D. and Dreyson H). Their posters were displayed on Golden Valley Memorial Healthcare's electronic sign.

Students at CMS enjoyed a variety of activities that were planned by their schools Youth Coalition, FLED (Free Life End Drugs). Students participated in spirit days, a pop-socket design contest, and Safe and Sober lessons with their guidance counselor, Mrs. Vaughn.

Students across the district also planted 166 tulips at their buildings to honor the 166 law enforcement officers who lost their lives in the line of duty in 2018.

The tulip campaign was sponsored by the Henry County Honor Coalition.

#CardinalPirde

post_text:
Advanced Marketing students in Mrs. Thompson's class spent the month of October creating their own press kits.

In the working world, a journalist would receive a press kit and decide whether or not to write about a product. Students wrote pitch letters and a press release, created business cards, and put together high-resolution product photos along with frequently asked questions. The press kits were designed to look like they were produced by the company that created the original product.

#CardinalPride

shared_text:
Clinton Cardinals XC & Track
November 2, 2019 at 5:51 PM ·

The Cardinals competed today in a really competitive district. Needing top 2 in team scores to advance to state or top 15 individually. Both the Boys and Girls teams placed 3rd overall with less than 20 places separating both teams from 2nd. They showed up to compete and worked very hard to pull in the “W”. However we do have some athletes placing in the top 15 and will be advancing to the State XC Meet Nov. 9th in Columbia.

State Bound and All-District:
Krislyn Brown
McKenna Mason
Chase Reno
Corwyn Gentry

Students were then challenged to find the percent chance of their offpsring based on parent genotype.

Perfect attendance isn't an easily achieved goal, but Henry Elementary School had 111 students who accomplished this during 1st quarter.

In an effort to focus on student achievement and celebrate student success, Henry Elementary's building partner, Golden Valley Memorial Healthcare, provides a quarterly luncheon to students who are able to accomplish this goal.

Great job students, you are on your way to great things! And thank you GVMH, for helping us celebrate our students' achievements.

Clinton Middle School students are playing the part of medical detectives in their STEM class.

Students are learning about the nervous system, including the different parts of the brain and the purpose they serve. In order to learn where to find these parts of the brain, students performed brain dissections on sheep brains.

This PLTW (Project Lead the Way) class is taught by Molly Glover.

#CardinalPride

Did you know that the CSD Transportation Department transports approximately 770 students every day and in September they traveled over 39,000 miles!

It's National School Bus Safety Week and we appreciate the men and women who insure that our students make it to school and home safely every single day.

Since 2010, all school buses in the CSD have passed the annual DOT state inspection with a perfect 100% score!

Below are some good safety guidelines for both bus riders and those who share the road with buses.

#CardinalPride #ThankABusDriver

On Friday, October 18th, Clinton High School FFA students provided a great opportunity for area 3rd graders.

In their "Food for America" program, FFA students taught elementary students that their food doesn't just come from the grocery store shelf. Third graders learned about the importance of the agriculture industry and how all of us depend on farmers.

There were many hands-on activities led by FFA students and many students even brought their own livestock to share with the 3rd graders.

The first picture below of 2019 CHS graduates, Dalton Phillips and Cody Nelson, was taken at CHS' Decision Day on May 2nd. Both young men announced their plans to attend the Missouri Welding Institute after graduation. On Decision Day, graduating seniors have the opportunity to share their "next steps" with their classmates, teachers and families.

The second picture of Dalton and Cody was recently taken upon graduation from the Missouri Welding Institute.

Prior to graduating from CHS last May, Dalton and Cody completed the welding program at Clinton Technical School, which gave them a head start at a great career in welding.

shared_text:
Clinton MO Rotary Club
October 17, 2019 at 9:31 PM ·

Clinton Rotary Club President Tony Curtis awards Clinton Middle School FACS (Family and Consumer Science) Teach Jamie Woods the Clinton Rotary Club's District Simplified Grant to be used for the remodeling and expansion of the Clinton Middle School FACS Kitchens. Clinton Rotary Club applies each year to Rotary District 6080 for matching funds through the District Simplified Grant to be used on a large project. Previous year we have helped The Samaritan Center with the Buddy Backpack Program, F.A.I.T.H. with computers for residents; Golden Valley Daycare Center with Equipment; New Benches for the County Courthouse, Landscaping at Clinton High School when it was built, Landscaping at the Early Childhood Center; and many other projects. This year President Tony Curtis choose the FACS Program as our project along with others who are helping with refurbishing and replacing appliances etc. Congratulations to Clinton Middle School FACS! Pictured are Jamie Woods-FACS Teacher at Clinton Middle School, Clinton Rotary Club President Tony Curtis and Rotary Club Vice President Carla Moberly.
text:
Thank you Clinton Rotary Club for your generous donation to help make this project possible.

We appreciate your continued commitment to our students and district.

#CardinalPride

Clinton MO Rotary Club

Previous year we have helped The Samaritan Center with the Buddy Backpack Program, F.A.I.T.H. with computers for residents; Golden Valley Daycare Center with Equipment; New Benches for the County Courthouse, Landscaping at Clinton High School when it was built, Landscaping at the Early Childhood Center; and many other projects. post_text:
Empowering and preparing students for life after high school is important, and this happened at this week's College and Career Fair.

All of the district's juniors and seniors, as well as 200 students from 6 nearby districts, had the opportunity to talk to approximately 70 colleges, businesses, union representatives, technical schools, and military representatives during this annual event.

Thanks to Leslie Largent, Career Services Coordinator at Clinton Technical School, for her work in arranging such a successful event.

#CardinalPride

1,209

That's the average number of lunches that the CSD's food service department prepares and serves on a daily basis (they also serve over 800 breakfasts everyday)!

On National School Lunch Week, we celebrate the men and women who play a very important role in the day-to-day operations of our schools and in the lives of our students.

post_text:
Tomorrow, October 15th, from 1:00-3:00, all juniors and seniors at CHS will have the opportunity to attend the annual College and Career Fair.

Students do not have to be enrolled at Clinton Technical School or Clinton High School to attend the College & Career Fair. Parents are welcome to attend as well.

Universities, community colleges, military, technical & trade schools, and area businesses will be present to share information and answer any questions students may have. This will provide a great opportunity to explore and compare options for students’ post high school endeavors.

#CardinalPride
